result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlie P Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charlie P Martin

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:18pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant does not appear.
(Review on payment of restitution)

State requests matter be reset - Defendant was to pay correct restitution; COURT directs review to be reset for 2 weeks.

Adj: 1:18pm

RECALLED: 2:04pm -- Defendant now appears.

State notes all restitution paid
State requests COURT enter judgment on Ct. 1.

COURT finds defendant guilty and enters judgment on Ct. 1.

COURT ORDERS: $100+CC (NO DNA costs)

ADJ: 2:06pm
Review hearing on March 14, 2016 at 01:10 pm.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:50am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person/pro se.
(Review of DEJ)

Parties request matter be reset for Plea next Monday at 1:10pm for defendant to bring in proper amount of restitution.
COURT grants and resets matter for 3/14 at 1:10pm - Bond continues.

Adj: 8:51am

Clerk Cheree
Case called:  9:32am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/pro se.  
  VRCW - written victim impact statement filed

COURT QUASHES BW previously entered this morning and vacates BFH.

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Felony Issue Worthless Checks)>>AMEND to Misd Issue Wthls Checks pursuant to 9.43.24(1)
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Misd. Issue Worthless Check)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis.
  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.

COURT defers matter for a period of 5 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of  DEJ agreement (Obtain no new criminal charges; Pay restitution of $2819.50 to DA's office for victim Nolan Sales of no less than $250/week to commence 10/30/15).
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of DEJ agreement within that time frame, State to request entry of judgment and recommend $100+CC; If defendant not successful, State to argue sentence.

DEOJ RH>> 3/7/16 at 8:30am -- COURT advises defendant he must appear on that date.
Bond continues.

Adj: 9:41am

State notes defendant has also not paid restitution.
COURT issues BW - $1000
BFH set for for 11/6/15 8:30am
